Comment: It‚Äôs sort of funny, because that‚Äôs true of the mainstream congressional type Dems, and also true for a lot of the more activist types.   The GOP left a blueprint for taking the reins of society (run for minor offices, make the policy changes you want to make, move upwards), and they won‚Äôt follow that example either. It‚Äôs way easier to change a policy if you got elected to *be the guy in the job* than it is by protesting and petitioning some other guy in that job who disagrees with you. And it‚Äôs way easier to take over an existing party infrastructure bit by bit than to build a new one.   None of this is a secret! The big dogs in congress should oppose everything with strong language, and the individual change agents should run for dogcatcher / school board / etc. (The Dems even have the advantage of their policy positions polling well for the most part!)
